description: [GAVI] Geneva -- In 2024, lower-income countries supported by Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance contributed more than US$ 250 million, a record, towards their own immunisation programmes. 19% year-on-year increase in financing, secured primarily from domestic resources, underlines countries' commitment towards sustainably financing vaccination. From 2026 to 2030, low- and middle-income countries are expected to contribute US$ 4 billion - or nearly half - of the costs vaccination programmes introduced with Gavi support.
title: Africa: Lower-Income Countries Commit Record U.S.$ 250 Million Towards Immunisation

description: [Ethiopian Herald] ADDIS ABABA - Ethiopia and the African Union (AU) have jointly called for renewed commitment across the continent to expand labor-based investments as a sustainable strategy to curb youth unemployment and promote inclusive development.
title: Africa: Ethiopia, AU Push for Labor-Based Investment

description: [allAfrica] As countries grapple with the fallout from the Trump administration's retreat from the international order, experts question whether this will accelerate global fragmentation. Pedro Abramovay,  Vice President of Programs at the Open Society Foundations, argues that this shift could, paradoxically, enable stronger international cooperation, particularly around global taxation, which would benefit Africa and the global south.
title: Africa: Is the New Global Order a Boon for International Taxation Collaboration?

description: [ISS] The AES-ECOWAS split has sparked pragmatic cooperation based on strategic interests between neighbouring countries.
title: West Africa: Can Realpolitik Drive Renewed Regional Cooperation in West Africa?

description: [IPS] Bulawayo -- More people are dying from once treatable infections because the medicines we rely on are no longer working as they should. The culprit? A growing health threat called antimicrobial resistance (AMR).
title: Africa: How Germs Outsmart Antimicrobials and Why It's Making Us Sicker

description: [FrontPageAfrica] Geneva -- The Minister of Health, Dr. Louise Mapleh Kpoto, on Saturday chaired a pivotal session of the World Health Organization (WHO) in Geneva, Switzerland, where Tanzanian cardiologist Prof. Mohammed Yakub Janabi was officially nominated as the next WHO Regional Director for Africa.
title: Africa: Health Minister Chairs WHO Session That Nominates Tanzanian Professor As Next Africa Regional Director

description: [FrontPageAfrica] Paris -- Liberia's Special Envoy on Cultural and Heritage Diplomacy, Ambassador Lorenzo Llewellyn Witherspoon, has delivered a powerful keynote address at the opening of UNESCO Africa Week 2025, held at the organization's headquarters in Paris. Speaking under the theme, "Global Solidarity for the Restitution and Restoration of African Heritage through Education, Culture, and Sciences," Ambassador Witherspoon issued a clarion call for global action to reclaim Africa's legacy and dignity through science, culture,
title: Africa: Ambassador Witherspoon Calls for Global Solidarity to Restore African Heritage At Unesco Africa Week 2025

description: [Liberian Observer] Let's talk about house rent. That figure that quietly eats half your paycheck, wages or salary. That monthly or yearly ritual of negotiation, panic, and fervent prayer. From Lagos and Accra to Monrovia.
title: Africa: Your House Rent Is Too High? Here's Who's Really to Blame

description: [Liberian Observer] CAMBRIDGE -- Power is the ability to get others to do what you want. That can be accomplished by coercion ("sticks"), payment ("carrots"), and attraction ("honey"). The first two methods are forms of hard power, whereas attraction is soft power. Soft power grows out of a country's culture, its political values, and its foreign policies. In the short term, hard power usually trumps soft power. But over the long term, soft power often prevails. Joseph Stalin once mockingly asked, "How many divisions does the Pope have?"
title: Africa: The Future of American Soft Power

description: [allAfrica] Accra -- Bees are speaking to us -- not with sound, but through their presence, their absence, and their steady disappearance. Alongside butterflies, bats, beetles, some mammals, and birds, these tireless workers sustain the crops and wild plants that feed us, protect biodiversity, and keep our agrifood systems resilient. When they thrive, ecosystems flourish. When they falter, so could we.
title: Africa: What the Bees Are Telling Africa #WorldBeeDay
Africa: All of Africa Today - May 20, 2025

description: [New Times] President Paul Kagame on Monday, May 19, said that Africa's future, particularly matters of peace and security, cannot be outsourced, pointing out that it has been, for far too long, treated as a burden to be managed by others.
title: Africa: Africa's Peace, Security Cannot Be Outsourced - Kagame

description: [African Union] The African Union Commission, in collaboration with the Government of Ethiopia and the Institute for Security Studies, convened a High-Level Policy Dialogue on the Development and Regulation of AI in Africa in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. The dialogue brought together participants from over 40 African countries, including Heads of State and Government, Ministers, AU Commissioners, diplomats, civil society, academia, and private sector leaders.
title: Africa: Africa Declares AI a Strategic Priority As High-Level Dialogue Calls for Investment, Inclusion, and Innovation

description: [African Union] We the African Union Commission and participants from African countries, including African Heads of State and Government, Ministers of Foreign Affairs, Ministers of Information, Communication and Technology, representatives of the Diplomatique Community, International Organizations, Civil Society, the Private Sector, and the Academic and Research Communities gathered in Addis Ababa on 17 May 2025.
title: Africa: Communiqué of the High Level Policy Dialogue On the Development and Regulation of Ai in Africa

description: [UN News] The Deputy Prosecutors of the International Criminal Court have assumed leadership of the Office of the Prosecutor following Karim Khan's decision to take a leave of absence amid an ongoing UN investigation into allegations of misconduct against him.
title: Africa: International Criminal Court - Deputies Take Over Amid Prosecutor Misconduct Probe

description: [UN News] The 78th World Health Assembly opened on Monday with a broad appeal to global solidarity, as delegates from around the world gather in Geneva to confront mounting health, climate, and financial challenges - and finalise a global treaty to head off the next pandemic.
title: Africa: World Health Assembly Opens Amid High-Stakes Pandemic Treaty Vote, Global Funding Crisis

description: [The Conversation Africa] President Donald Trump's executive order withdrawing the US from the Paris Agreement raises the question of the implications for small African Indian Ocean island states.
title: Africa: African Islands Under Threat - What to Do About Trump's Withdrawal From Climate Change Agreement

description: [IPS] Bratislava -- The international community must take action to uphold international humanitarian law, say healthcare and rights advocates, as attacks on healthcare in war zones reached a record high last year.
title: Africa: Health Workers in Conflict Zones Experience an Epidemic of Violence

description: [IPS] Nice, France -- Seafood is a staple in my house - fish tacos, paella, sushi. But no matter how good it tastes, I can't help but wonder: was my fish caught responsibly? Or did something go horribly wrong before it ever reached my plate?
title: Africa: Seafood Without Transparency Is a Recipe for Disaster
